item.title: Moderator please lock this
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
i changed my mind from changing it.

Icibalus:

That’s situational. REALLY SITUATIONAL

that’s why you only have 2 uses.

Icibalus:

This class is useful IF there are 3 confirmed BD alive and you are as well, you have someone who you defeinitely don’t trust WITHOUT a Sherrif check, someone else who you trust but isn’t confirmed, and IF you couldn’t just push their lynch anyway without all the song and dance of an overcomplicated trial.

you only need a majority good guys. if you still have veto, you only need one to veto the result.

Read full topic

item.title: Moderator please lock this
item.dc:creator: Icibalus
item.description:
It is bad.

It’s swingy, it’s against the spirit of the game, and it’s hard for newbies to understand.

What I mean is this:

This class is useful IF there are 3 confirmed BD alive and you are as well, you have someone who you defeinitely don’t trust WITHOUT a Sherrif check, someone else who you trust but isn’t confirmed, and IF you couldn’t just push their lynch anyway without all the song and dance of an overcomplicated trial.

That’s situational. REALLY SITUATIONAL

Read full topic

item.description:
Icibalus:

It’s swingy.

That’s what I mean. It’s either useless or it’s overpowered.

Do you understand that this is bad?

I’m going to change it, but it is not bad.

item.description:
Listen:

It’s ability is too situational! It’s ability is too overcomplicated!
It’s ability takes away chances to deceive in a game of deception.

How many times have you had to say ‘If’ to explain how the Unseen could hijack the trial?
See! The more 'if’s the worse a class is.

item.title: Moderator please lock this
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
Icibalus:

I meant that the whole point of the game is deception, and hijacking wagons to force mislynches. Making a role just to counter this is dumb.

there can still be hijacking. An unseen can become prosecutor when there is an unseen on trial and be really unconvincing.

an unseen that previously made themselves trusted can become a juror.

anyone can speak to jurors and give false information.

plenty of opportunities to hi-jack

item.title: Moderator please lock this
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
Icibalus:

And only one person can do that. Sorry, you need to sit out, you weren’t elected! WATCH EVERYONE PLAY THE GAME FOR YOU.

if 16 players alive:

1 of them is a defendant.
5 are jurors.
1 is a judge.
there will be prosecutor, but anyone can try to be the prosecutor.
everyone can talk to jurors during deliberation.

5+1+1 = 7/16

item.title: Moderator please lock this

item.description:
Oh great. 4 roles need to be alive in endgame, at which point you don’t even need the role because BD will almost certainly win.

WHY IS THIS BETTER? It makes Trials drag on and not everyone can get questions in. The whole point of trials is that it’s meant to be easy for people to hijack them.

It’s the whole point of the game. You can’t cancel out the point of a game twice, Unseen or not.
It removes all the skill from trials.
